title: Genk vs Liverpool LIVE: Stream, score and latest updates from Youth League
text:
Liverpool take on Genk in the Champions League this evening aiming to finally win a European away match.

The Reds lost all three of their away group games last season – before beating Tottenham Hotspur in the final – and lost their opening match of this year’s campaign, in Naples.

You can follow live coverage of their match against Genk in Belgium, after the latest updates from the Uefa Youth League fixture between the two sides.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Genk vs Liverpool Uefa Youth League fixture kicks-off at 1pm

Uefa Champions League fixture kicks-off at 8pm

Hello and welcome to our live coverage of Genk vs Liverpool in the Uefa Youth League and Champions League.

Match preview:

When is it?

Kick-off is at 8pm BST on Wednesday 23rd October.

How can I watch it?

The match will be broadcast on BT Sport 2, with coverage beginning at 7pm.

Subscribers to BT Sport can watch the game online or on mobile via the BT Sport player and BT Sport app.

Team news

Mohamed Salah may be fit enough to feature in the game after missing the Manchester United draw with an ankle issue.

Jurgen Klopp could look to rest players ahead of this weekend’s game with Tottenham, which means there could be opportunities for James Milner and Adam Lallana to start, while Joe Gomez could come in at the back.
